Congratulations to this year's Envirothon Team for winning 3rd place overall in the Utah State Competition! This year's topic was Water Resource Management - Local Control and Local Solutions. These students worked very hard during online learning and social distancing to compile a 12 minute video for the oral presentation and take an online test, like the online AP tests this year.
This year's team was Rachel Love (captain), Grace Dochod (captain), McKayla Trinnaman, Sam Makin, Henry Rimmasch, and alternate, Cristian Urbina. Auxiliary members were Avery Parrish, Kai Bowen, and Olivia Choberka.
Congratulations on your hard work and hard-earned win!
Next year's Current Issue topic is Climate Change and Natural Resource-Dependent Communities. If you're interested in becoming an Envirothon competing member, please email or see Ms. Roberts in the fall. We would love to have you!

The students who volunteered for the project have been working since January researching topics regarding the impact of the transcontinental railroad in Utah. At DaVinci Elementary a central theme for this school year is "Our Story Matters". As students, teachers, staff and administrators we gather to tell our own stories, sharing them with our little community. Part of this work is to bring in Community Heroes who have their own stories to tell.

This year we had the great honor of welcoming, artists, teachers, scientists, political candidates, community activists, entrepreneurs, and inventive thinkers into our little school. They each spoke as to why they have dedicated their lives to others, and to inspire our students to make the world a better place. We feel fortunate to have had the following Community Heros among us: Leah A. Murray, PhD., Holly Morphet, Adam Johnston, PhD., Chris Harris, Kimberly Bowsher and Deana Froerer. Their impact is far reaching and echoes of their messages can be heard in each classroom as students begin their final project of the year: Identifying a problem to be solved in their world and finding ways to be part of the solution.
